variants.Description in input context: A53T mutation associated with early-onset Parkinson's disease
A30P mutation linked to familial Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids encoding wild-type or mutant SNCA proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: A53T variant exhibited increased α-synuclein aggregation compared to wild-type.
A30P variant showed enhanced oligomerization and reduced clearance rates.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across three independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each Western blot was performed in triplicate with independent protein lysates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing cells served as positive controls for normal protein function.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as negative controls for baseline aggregation.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test for multiple comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Aggregation levels below 15% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Aggregation levels exceeding 40% of wild-type controls.

Approved assay.Description: Standard methods for α-synuclein aggregation analysis in Parkinson's research.
